text: Hillary Bacon Store, also known as Woolworth's, was a historic commercial building located in downtown Evansville, Indiana. It was designed by the architecture firm Shopbell & Company and built in 1921. It was in Chicago school style architecture. Note: This includes , , and Accompanying photographs It was destroyed by fire in 1990. It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1982 and delisted in 1993. ==References== Category:Former National Register of Historic Places in Indiana Category:Commercial buildings on the National Register of Historic Places in Indiana Category:Commercial buildings completed in 1921 Category:Buildings and structures in Evansville, Indiana Category:National Register of Historic Places in Evansville, Indiana Category:Chicago school architecture in Indiana
title: Hillary Bacon Store (Woolworth's)
